snippet: The measure, passed in St. Petersburg, is similar to laws adopted in other Russian cities, and is aimed at eliminating what its proponents called “propaganda” of homosexuality.
abstract: St Petersburg’s legislature passes a law aimed at eliminating what its backers call 'propaganda' of homosexuality among minors, prompting fears among gay rights groups of an impending crackdown on their activities as other Russian cities vow to look into adopting similar measures.
lead_paragraph: The measure, passed in St. Petersburg, is similar to laws adopted in other Russian cities, and is aimed at eliminating what its proponents called “propaganda” of homosexuality.

headline.seo: Anti-Gay Law Stirs Fears in Russia
headline.main: Anti-Gay Law Stirs Fears in Russia
headline.print_headline: A City’s Law Against Gay ‘Propaganda’ Worries Rights Advocates in Russia
